title: How to Construct a 30 Degrees Angle Using Compass and Straightedge

steps.title: Draw a ray AB.
steps.content: Draw a ray AB. Let A be the vertex of the angle we're going to construct. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Place the tip of the compass on A and draw an arc which cuts AB at some point (say X).
steps.content: Place the tip of the compass on A and draw an arc which cuts AB at some point (say X). Let's call this arc as Arc One . Retain this width of the compass for the remaining steps. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Place the tip of the compass on X and draw another arc (call it Arc Two) which cuts Arc One at some point (say Y).
steps.content: Place the tip of the compass on X and draw another arc (call it Arc Two ) which cuts Arc One at some point (say Y). [4] X Research source

steps.title: Place the tip of the compass on Y and draw another arc (Arc Three) so as to cut Arc Two at a point (say Z) which is on that side of Arc Two which does not contain the point A.
steps.content: Place the tip of the compass on Y and draw another arc ( Arc Three ) so as to cut Arc Two at a point (say Z) which is on that side of Arc Two which does not contain the point A.

steps.title: Connect the points A and Z with a straight line and extend it to form a ray AC.
steps.content: Connect the points A and Z with a straight line and extend it to form a ray AC. [5] X Research source The measure of the angle CAB is 30 o . Erase any extraneous constructions if you so wish. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Construct a 60o angle as described [7] X Research source here.
steps.content: Construct a 60 o angle as described [7] X Research source here .

steps.title: Bisect the 60o angle as described here.
steps.content: Bisect the 60 o angle as described here . [8] X Research source Upon bisection, you'll have two angles measuring 30 o each.
